details:
SO-AND-SO reports:

> Unit 1.34.2 fixes two issues in the Java language module websocket code.
>
> 1. It addresses a potential security issue where we could get a negative
>    payload length that could cause the Java language module process(es) to
>    enter an infinite loop and consume excess CPU. This was a bug carried
>    over from the initial Java websocket code import. It has been re-issued
>    a CVE number (CVE-2025-1695).
> 2. It addresses an issue whereby decoded payload lengths would be limited
>    to 32 bits.
